articles.author: Emma Farge, Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: The United States and China said on Monday they have agreed a deal to slash reciprocal tariffs for now as the world's two biggest economies seek to end a trade war that has disrupted the global outlook and set financial markets on edge.
articles.title: US and China reach deal to slash trade tariffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The release, which could come as early as Monday, could open the way to freeing the rest of the 59 hostages still held in Gaza.
articles.title: Israel says not committed to Hamas ceasefire, only to safe corridor for U.S. hostage release

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. and European diplomats went on a flurry of calls in the hours after U.S. President Donald Trump offered on Monday to join prospective Ukraine-Russia talks later this week, trying to find a path that would bring an end to the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Rush of diplomatic calls follow Trump's offer to join potential Russia-Ukraine talks

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese was sworn in for a second term on Tuesday, alongside his ministers, after a landslide win at a national election he said had returned the largest centre-left Labor government since federation in 1901.
articles.title: Australia's Albanese Labor government sworn in for second term

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Pesha Magid
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump will arrive in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday morning to kick off a four-day swing through the Gulf region, a trip that will focus more on economic deals than on the security crises besetting the region, from the war in Gaza to the threat of escalation over Iran's nuclear program.
articles.title: Trump starts Gulf visit seeking big economic deals

articles.author: Tim Cocks
articles.description: The first 49 white South Africans deemed victims of racial discrimination and granted refugee status under an offer by U.S. President Donald Trump were flying to the U.S. on Monday in a move deepening frictions between the two nations.
articles.title: First white South Africans fly to US under Trump refugee plan

articles.author: Sergio Goncalves, Miguel Pereira
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of devotees of the Virgin Mary on Monday gathered at the sanctuary of Fatima in Portugal to pray for newly-appointed Pope Leo XIV and global peace.
articles.title: Some 270,000 pilgrims pray for Pope Leo and peace in Portugal's Fatima shrine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's comment on "unification" was about the U.S.-China trade relationship and U.S. policy towards Taiwan has not changed, the de facto embassy on the island said on Tuesday, after the wording caused unease in Taipei.
articles.title: US mission in Taipei says Trump's 'unification' comment was about US-China trade

articles.author: Natalia Siniawski
articles.description: The top diplomats from Kenya and the Dominican Republic met in Santo Domingo on Monday and called on the international community to fulfill and expand its promised funding for the UN-backed security mission in neighboring Haiti.
articles.title: Dominican Republic, Kenya call for funds for struggling Haiti security effort

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bangladesh's Election Commission has suspended the registration of ousted former prime minister Sheikh Hasina's Awami League, effectively barring the party from contesting the next national elections.
articles.title: Ousted Bangladesh PM Hasina’s party barred from election as party registration suspended
